page.title: 05 COOKLEY SCHOOL
page.content: Cookley's school was built over one hundred years ago. Although it is run by the Hereford and Worcester Education Authority, it is aided financially by the {Sebright Trustees. Originally the school catered for pupils upto the statutory leaving age,firstly 12 the 14. On building a Secoindary school at Sion Hill near { {Wolverly ,}Cookley became a Primary(5-11) school. Under reorganisation in the county in 1973 Cookley became a First (5-9) school. At present it has just 100 pupils and 4 staff. At 9 years of age the children leave the intimacy of the small village school to go to SION HILL Middle School,which also takes its pupils from Wolverly,Blakedown,Churchill and the outskirts of Kidderminster.
